para: OOF.Skeleton.Auto tries to create and refine a &skel; with no feedback from the user. It actually runs a series of other &oof2; commands, so the Auto command itself will never appear in a log file. After automatically creating a &skel; the Undo command can be applied multiple times to undo the separate steps used in creating the &skel;.

Auto inherits a few parameters from the commands that it invokes, and it adds a few of its own. It begins by creating a new &skel; with quadrilateral elements. The size of the elements is set so that the initial &skel; resolves features of size maxscale in the µ. If units is Physical, then maxscale is assumed to be in physical units; if it's Pixel, then it's assumed to be in units of the µ's pixel size; if it's Fractional, then it's assumed to be relative to the µ's overall dimensions. The periodicity of the &skel; is set by the parameters left_right_periodicity and top_bottom_periodicity, which have the same meanings that they have in .

After creating the initial &skel;, Auto then Refines the &skel;, using unconditional bisection with the liberal ruleset and alpha=0.8, until the linear dimensions of the smallest &elems; are smaller than minscale. To get rid of rough corners, Auto applies once, with min_distance set to 0.0. All refinement operations are applied only to elements whose homogeneity is less than the specified threshold.

After refining, Auto cleans up the &skel; by applying twice, with alpha=0.8. It uses the specific s (ratio=5.0), (angle=150), and (acute_angle=15, obtuse_angle=150). Finally, it s the &skel; after pinning the internal boundary &nodes;, which it unpins when it's done. The smoothing is done with alpha=0.3 for 5 iterations.
